page.title: 06 VEGETABLE RESEARCH STATION
page.content: The National Vegetable Research Station was moved to Wellesbourne in 1949.The site covers 1.9 sq.km.and until a few years ago employed over two hundred people. Government cuts have recently reduced this number dramatically. The work at the Station is under the control of the Ministry of Agriculture who also provide most of the finance. Aspects of the work include Plant Breeding,Plant Physiology,Gene Bank, Plant Pathology,Soil Science,Pest Control,and Bio-Chemistry.There is a large area of glasshouses, which are under automatic control, as well as a farm which is operated for profit. Extensive use is made of computers.
